Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the event log examples First case ID 1 It goes RA VF AE RMI VF AD SC AC Case ID 2 is similar but skips RMI so its RA VF AE AD SC AC Case ID 3 has multiple RMIs and VFs

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So the main flow seems to be a sequence of Receive Application RA Validate Form VF Assess Eligibility AE then there might be one or more loops involving RMI and VF followed by Approval Decision AD Send Confirmation SC and Archive Case AC

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: So I need to model this with a process tree that allows for the optional loop of RMI VF after AE Lets break it down Start with RA Followed by sequence of VF AE After AE there should be an optional loop that can repeat RMI and then possibly VF again After possible loops sequence AD SC AC

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: The loop could have a parallel for RMI and another activity but in the log after each RMI its followed by VF So maybe inside the loop after RMI there is an optional choice between looping back to RMI or proceeding

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Alternatively maybe AE should lead into a sequence where one path is directly to AD and another path is a loop of RMI VF But since case 3 shows multiple RMIs and VFs perhaps theres a sequence that allows for the parallel execution but in our model we need an exclusive choice where it could choose to go into the loop or proceed

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So putting this all together The root is a parallel operator One child of root is the main path RA VF AE The other child is a sequence that starts at AE and then either A loop containing RMI followed by another choice between looping back to RMI or proceeding If proceed after RMI VF it would go to AD SC AC The final process tree structure should capture this logic with the appropriate operators Lets write that out step by step
